INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
2

Allegation Allegations of an improper restraint causing youth to be in prone
position and receive injuries.
Investigation Youth A/Complainant was interviewed by this Consultant during an
unannounced face-to-face visit on 12/27/2023. She confirmed that she
had been restrained a few days prior and stated that she went to the
hospital the next day. Youth A stated that her ankle was bruised but not
broken and that it was getting better. She showed a right upper arm
bruise and a right knee bruise as well. Youth A stated that she heard
Supervisor 1 say to her “You broke my building, so I’m going to break
your heel.” Youth A also made allegations that Supervisor 1 was
whispering about her to another youth in the days after the incident.
Youth A was re-interviewed during an unannounced face-to-face visit
on 01/04/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and Law Enforcement. She stated
that when the restraint occurred, she was in the cafeteria with other
staff. Youth A confirmed that she had been running around and “acting
a fool” while describing how dysregulated she was leading up to the
restraint. This also included breaking into the kitchen and attempting to
light things on fire, throwing pots and pans around, opening a first aid
kit, running around with scissors, as well as spraying fire extinguishers
around the building. Youth A stated that at one point during the
incident she was near the front entrance with a fire extinguisher in her
hand, and Youth A alleged that Supervisor 1 came from behind and
grabbed the extinguisher and threw it on the ground. Youth A then
stated that Supervisor 1 grabbed her by the throat while facing her and
slammed her on the front couch. Youth A recalled Supervisor 1 calling
her a “pussy” and a “scary ass.” Youth A stated that the chaotic
incident then continued when she eventually made her way into the
cafeteria. Youth A recalled walking past Staff 1 who then followed her
inside the cafeteria. Supervisor 1 then stated, “take her down.” Youth A
stated that Supervisor 1 had her hands on Youth A‘s arms and, as she
went to the ground, Youth A fell to her side. Youth A then stated she
was laying on her stomach for a brief period before Supervisor 1
grabbed the back of her neck and flipped her whole body over with the
one hand. Youth A stated that she was attempting to hit Supervisor 1
and kick and fight during the incident. She confirmed that Supervisor 1
eventually had her left hand, Staff 1 on her right hand and Staff 5 was
trying to hold down her legs during the floor restraint. Youth A
confirmed that she was on her back for this portion of the restraint.
Youth A then stated that she was hyperventilating and gagging causing
her to spit. Youth A stated that her shirt was pulled up from her
midsection to cover her face to block the spit. Youth A recalled that she
eventually pulled her arms out and pushed the three staff out of the
way. She stated that at that point, no one was touching her, and Staff 4
came in and spoke to her. Youth A stated that her ankle began hurting
at that moment, and she believed it was broken. She recalled
4

Supervisor 1 allegedly saying “get up and walk to your damn unit.”
Youth A confirmed that she received over-the-counter medication that
evening and went to urgent care the next day, where it was confirmed
that her ankle was not broken.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 01/04/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 and
Law Enforcement. She confirmed that she is a residential care
supervisor and has worked at the facility for 16 years. Supervisor 1
stated that she has no discipline in her employee file, which was
confirmed. Supervisor 1 stated that she was not actually at work as the
incident in question started to occur. She got a call from Staff 1 while
offsite that Youth A was spraying fire extinguishers, so she came back
to the facility. As Supervisor 1 got to the facility she came in the front
entrance and witnessed the fire extinguisher exhaust everywhere.
Supervisor 1 recalled fire alarms going off. She also recalled making
sure that Youth B was taken care of because Youth B suffers from
asthma and was physically bothered by all the exhaust. Supervisor 1
stated that she saw Youth A near the front entrance and took the fire
extinguisher from her. Supervisor 1 denied that she did this in an
aggressive manner. She did state that she gave several loud directives
to go sit down, and Youth A complied. Supervisor 1 denied putting her
hands on Youth A in any way during this part of the incident. She stated
that she then went to the cafeteria to assess additional damage. She
recalled that Youth A followed her back into the cafeteria. Supervisor 1
cannot remember exactly what Youth A was saying, but she believed
she was highly escalated and doing a lot of yelling and screaming.
Supervisor 1 recalled stating something to the effect of “just sit down,
you already tore the building up.” Supervisor 1 stated that Youth A
eventually started to approach her and took multiple swings at her, and
she believed those were attempts to punch her. Supervisor 1 instructed
Staff 1 to come with her and put Youth A in a standing restraint.
Supervisor 1 recalled that Youth A was physically struggling, and
eventually the restraint went down to the floor. Supervisor 1 stated that
this was not completely intentional in the moment. Supervisor 1 denied
that Youth A was ever in a prone position, but that Youth A fell to her
side and then rolled to her back immediately and began to kick at staff.
She then stated that upon Youth A laying on her back on the floor she
instructed Staff 1 to get Staff 5 to be involved. Supervisor 1 described
an identical physical set up for the restraint as Youth A. Supervisor 1
recalled Youth A doing a lot of kicking. Supervisor 1 stated that Staff 4
came in to relieve Staff 5 and help with the restraint. Supervisor 1
stated that Youth A was attempting to spit on all of the staff that were
near them. She stated that the staff used the bottom of Youth A’s shirt
as a shield, but denied that the shirt was ever within inches of Youth A‘s
face and denied that it would have obstructed her breathing in any way.
Supervisor 1 stated that she knew Youth A did not have any trouble
4

breathing, because she continued to yell throughout the entirety of the
incident. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A stating that her heel hurt
towards the end of the restraint. Eventually, Youth A was able to
confirm that she felt like she was going to be safe, and the restraint
ended. Supervisor 1 recalled Youth A sitting with Staff 4 and asking to
talk to the police. Supervisor 1 confirmed that an officer came to the
facility that night. Supervisor 1 stated that it was possible that Youth A
had heard her or other staff discussing the possibility of charges being
pressed against her because of the damage done to the facility.
Supervisor 1 denied allegations that she used any inappropriate
language during the incident itself, or in the days since then. In addition,
she denied that there were any situations where she was discussing
Youth A‘s situation with any other youth, whether that be in front of
Youth A, or outside of her presence. At the conclusion of the interview
staff showed DHHS Worker 1 the areas in the building where the
incident occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 and Law Enforcement
during an announced face-to-face visit on 01/04/2023. She stated that
she worked the night of the incident. During much of the incident she
was responsible for being the 1:1 staff with Youth B. However, Staff 1
stated that as Youth A escalated, she passed off that responsibility to
Staff 5. Staff 1 stated that Youth A began to escalate as a result of
having to combine units during the holiday because many other youth
were out of the facility. Staff 1 described a very similar course of
events as Youth A became more and more escalated, including the
incidents in the kitchen and front area involving the fire extinguishers.
Staff 1 stated that by the time she made it to the front to follow Youth A
she witnessed Supervisor 1 already back in the facility and Youth A
sitting on the couch. Supervisor 1 had the last fire extinguisher in her
possession by that point. Staff 1 stated that she witnessed Supervisor 1
being upset, but not more than normal, and did not hear her say
anything inappropriate. Staff 1 recalled talking with Supervisor 1 at that
point about the possibility of a restraint later if Youth A were to escalate
further and attempt to harm herself or anyone. Staff 1 stated that Youth
A then ran back through the front lobby of the facility to the cafeteria
and bumped into several staff, including Supervisor 1. Staff 1 stated
that Youth A then charged at Supervisor 1 and attempted to punch her.
She and Supervisor 1 then attempted to perform a standing restraint
and as they tried to back up from one of the walls, the three of them fell
to the ground. At that point Youth A was kicking and screaming at both
of the staff. Staff 1 stated that Youth A fell to her side initially, but both
of the staff adjusted her to her back immediately. Staff 1 described a
similar course of events involving Staff 4 rotating in to replace Staff 5 as
Youth A was continuing to fight. Staff 1 also described a similar
response to Youth A spitting, where staff lifted up the bottom of Youth
4

A‘s shirt approximately a foot and a half away from her face to block the
spit. She stated that the facility does have a mesh mask that they can
use during such an incident to attempt to ensure safety while also allow
the youth to breathe easily, but she stated that everything happened so
fast, and they were not able to get a staff to attempt to look for it in time.
Staff 1 recalled Youth A eventually committing to safety after
approximately another five minutes of struggling and the restraint
ended. Youth A was provided medical attention at that point, and the
urgent care that the facility works with requested that she be brought in
the next morning and gave advice for over-the-counter medication to
help with any pain in her ankle.
Youth B was interviewed during an announced face-to-face visit at the
facility on 01/08/2023 with DHHS Worker 1. Youth B stated that she
witnessed much of the incident because the staff responsible for her
1:1 supervision had to be involved or were near much of what was
occurring. Youth B stated that she was sprayed by some of the fire
extinguishers, and it triggered an asthma attack. She stated that staff
made sure that she was taken care of and that she received proper
medical attention as a result. Youth B stated that she witnessed staff
interacting with Youth A as she was escalated. Youth B denied hearing
anything inappropriate and denied witnessing any physical aggression
from staff. Youth B stated that she did not see the restraint itself that
occurred in the cafeteria as she was just outside it with her 1:1 staff and
was instructed not to enter the cafeteria at the time.
Youth C was interviewed during an announced face-to-face visit at the
facility on 01/18/2023 with DHHS Worker 1. Youth C stated that she
witnessed part of the incident in question but not all of it. She stated
that the parts of Youth A‘s escalation and everything that happened that
she witnessed, she did not hear any staff state anything antagonizing or
inappropriate to her. She also denied seeing any staff put their hands
on Youth A, although she did not witness the restraint itself
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an announced
face-to-face visit on 01/18/2023. Staff 2 confirmed that she works as
the cook for the facility but also covers direct care shifts at times as
well. She confirmed that she was filling in as a direct care staff the day
of the incident. Staff 2 stated that she was not a part of nor a witness to
the restraint, but she did hear Youth A speaking about it afterwards.
Youth A stated that Supervisor 1 had called her a “bitch” and had broke
her ankle. Staff 2 stated that she did not know if Youth A was telling the
truth or not, but that she immediately reported those allegations up to a
supervisor.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed on 01/18/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility. She stated that she did not
witness the restraint itself but that she spoke with Youth A immediately
afterwards. Staff 3 recalled Youth A alleging that Supervisor 1 choked
her from behind, which triggered her because her stepmother did the
same to her in the past. Staff 3 stated that Youth A also alleged that her
shirt was pulled directly over her face and that she could not breathe
during the restraint, as well as how her leg still hurt. Staff 3 noted that
she saw Youth A walking just fine at that point in the night, which was in
the succeeding hours after the incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 01/18/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility. Staff 4 confirmed that she
was a part of the incident in question and that she swapped in for
another staff member at the end of the restraint. Staff 4 described
Youth A as still escalated by the point she became involved, still kicking
and spitting and yelling. Prior to her involvement she witnessed
Supervisor 1, Staff 1 and Staff 5 being involved. Staff 5 asked to swap
out because she did not feel she could help contain Youth A‘s legs, so
Staff 4 swapped in. She stated she was the one who lifted up the
bottom of Youth A’s shirt to prevent spitting. She stated that doing this
did not ever cover Youth A’s whole face nor did ever touch her face.
She stated that from her position she was not able to get the shirt close
enough to the point where it may have restricted Youth A’s breathing.
She also stated that she knows that the facility has a mesh spit guard
that can be used in that situation but did not know where it was located
at that moment. Staff 4 stated that the restraint ended after a few
minutes when Youth A continued to complain about her legs hurting
and then committed to safety and stopped spitting. She stated that in
the immediate aftermath of the restraint she saw Youth A limping on
one occasion, but also walking fine on another.
Staff 5 was interviewed on 01/18/2023 with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit at the facility. She confirmed that she was
working in the facility the night of Youth A‘s restraint. Staff 5 recalled a
similar reason for the escalation in behavior from Youth A, and that she
did not want to go to a separate unit during the holidays when there
were less youth in the facility. She stated that she was a part of the
incident where Youth A broke into the kitchen and attempted to light
things on fire, throw pots and pans, and got her hands on a pair of
scissors. Staff 5 stated that her strategy during every part of the
incident that led up to the restraint was just to manage the environment
for Youth A. She stated this was in part due to not feeling completely
confident on when a restraint might be necessary. Staff 5 recalled
Youth A spraying the fire extinguishers at staff as well as without aim.
She stated she followed Youth A to the lobby and that she witnessed
4

Youth A interacting with Supervisor 1 when Supervisor 1 first arrived
back at the facility. Staff 5 stated that she never witnessed Supervisor 1
escalate emotionally with Youth A or get physical and put hands on her
at that point of the incident. Staff 5 took Youth B back to one of the
units to allow her to get some fresh air because of the fire extinguisher
exhaust. She stated that she heard on her walkie-talkie that extra staff
was needed because Youth A attempted to fight Supervisor 1. Staff 5
stated that she swapped out with another staff member to ensure that
Youth B’s one-on-one supervision was continued and then went to the
cafeteria. Staff 5 stated that she witnessed Youth A “walking up” on
Supervisor 1 and swinging in an attempt to punch her. Staff 5 stated
that she witnessed Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 attempt a standing restraint
on Youth A, but that they quickly fell to the floor at which point Staff 5
helped with Youth A‘s legs. Staff 5 stated that Youth A was spitting and
kicking. At one point Staff 5 called over for Staff 4 to replace her in an
attempt to better restrain Youth A’s legs from kicking the staff. She also
called on Staff 4 to get the spit guard mask but believed that there was
not enough time to grab it to use while Youth A was spitting. Staff 5
recalled hearing Youth A state that Supervisor 1 broke her ankle, but
noted that Supervisor 1 was not near Youth A‘s legs at any point during
the restraint. For a while Youth A would not respond when asked if she
was able to commit to safety to end the restraint, but eventually did so
and the restraint ended. Staff 5 stated that she did not see Youth A limp
at all. She believed that the restraint was warranted, quick, and was
performed appropriately. Staff 5 stated that she was around Youth A
the rest of the night and the next day and heard Youth A discussing the
incident, but never heard her mention anything about choking or the
allegations involving Supervisor 1 from prior to the restraint.
Documents reviewed:
 Report from Vassar Police Department dated 01/19/2023.
Criminal claims from Youth A were unsubstantiated and the case
is considered closed.
 Medical records from Covenant HealthCare dated 12/23/2023
documenting medical care for Youth A. These records state that
Youth A was experiencing right heel pain, but it was not as a
result of anything broken. Youth A was also prescribed an
inhaler to assist with sore throat symptoms as a result of
inhalation of fire extinguisher exhaust. No mention is made of
Youth A stating she was choked or any injuries as a result of that
allegation.
 3 Incident Reports forms related to the incident dated
12/22/2023, 12/22/2023 and 12/24/2023. These documents
coincide with staff recollections of the incident.
4

 Client Incident Debriefing form from the facility dated
12/22/2023. It is noted that Youth A refused to participate in the
facility’s restraint debriefing procedures.
 Pictures of the end result of the incident and damage done to the
facility were provided by Supervisor 1 that show extensive fire
extinguisher exhaust and disarray in the kitchen.
Analysis Through face-to-face interviews of staff and youth at the facility as well
as documentation review it was found that there was not sufficient
evidence to show that there was a rule violation as a result of the
restraint of Youth A. There was not evidence that Supervisor 1 choked
or slammed Youth A into a couch. There is evidence to show that the
restraint itself was performed appropriately. Evidence does not support
that Youth A was ever in a prone position. It is also inconclusive that
Supervisor 1 made any inappropriate comments during or after the
restraint.
Consultation provided on 01/31/2023: Consultation was provided
regarding staff training on restraints, more specifically ensuring that
direct care staff feel educated and confident on what situations may
require the use of a restraint. Consultation was also provided regarding
the use of a mesh spit mask. The facility has mesh spit mask, but
during the time of the incident staff could not locate it in a timely fashion
to utilize the tool to assist. The facility needs to access the cause and
address as needed to ensure tools are available to staff when needed.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
